DOC.brief_summary: The study was performed to assess the effect of PH-797804 on neutrophils (white cells) in the sputum after a challenge with an endotoxin (inhaled LPS). Neutrophils are a sign of inflammation and PH-797804 is being developed as a potential anti-inflammatory treatment for patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD).
DOC.brief_title: PH-797804 LPS Study in Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy male or female (WONCBP), non atopic volunteers aged 1850 years Able to produce sputum Current Smokers Abnormal liver function test Respiratory Tract Infection within 4 weeks
